result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Gary Crosby

records.addlTxt: to DE from Clerk. Sign and return bond by 10/31/22. arc

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brandy C (text messages allowed re: financials.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:53 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. 21CM454 STC and 22CM588 INIT: Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Brandy Lee Crosby. Defendant Brandy Lee Crosby appeared by video. 22CM500: Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Michael Gary Crosby. Defendant Michael Gary Crosby appeared by video.  Court reviews case. 21CM454 and 22CM588: Atty Bjork states victims M.G.C. request for bond modification. Atty Bjork states Victim has no objection to bond modification. Atty Perrin makes bond argument. 22CM588 AIA: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Atty Perrin has not discussed complaint with DE. Court to continue INIT. Bond argument.  22CM500: ADA Ballo objects to bond modification. Court amends bond. Court sets STC and INIT in case 22CM588. Adjourned 04:12 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

4:18 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Michael Gary Crosby. Defendant Michael Gary Crosby appeared by video. Victim Witness in Court. Victim appeared by video. Court reviews case. Victim makes statements. Atty Bjork states evidence based DV assessment was completed with a score of 2. ADA Ballo objects to bond modification and states headed towards trial. ADA Ballo notes victims bond was modified to NAC last month. Court does not modify bond at this time. Court sets BBH. Adjourned 04:28 PM
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:22 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Michael Gary Crosby in court.  Attorney John P Bjork in court for Michael Gary Crosby.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared with Erin of VW. Court reviews file and notes Atty Bjork was recently appointed. Petitioner filed bond modification request. Victim makes statement. Court will not modify bond at this time, but will consider modification after an evidence-based domestic violence assessment. Court sets STC via Zoom.  gll

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:22 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Michael Gary Crosby in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD-PFAC given.
